question: The given map relates to
option1: Kaniska at the time of his death
option2: Samudragupta after the close of his South Indian campaign
option3: Ashoka towards close of his reign
option4: Empire of Thaneswar on the eve of Harsha’s accession
answer: Ashoka towards close of his reign
explanation: The given map is related to the reign of Ashoka towards end of his rule. Ashoka (304–232 BC), popularly known as Ashoka the Great, was an Indian emperor of the Maurya Dynasty who ruled over the Indian subcontinent from 269 BC to 232 BC. His empire stretched from present-day Pakistan, Afghanistan in the west, to the present-day Bangladesh and the Indian state of Assam in the east, and as far south as northern Kerala and Andhra.
